channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Charlie Kirk, a Trump ally and voice for young conservatives, dies at age 31
item.description: Kirk, the founder of Turning Point USA, was arguably the most influential voice in young conservatism, and played a pivotal role in President Trump's return to the White House.
item.content:encoded:
Kirk, the founder of Turning Point USA, was arguably the most influential voice in young conservatism, and played a pivotal role in President Trump's return to the White House.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: In 2024, COVID dropped from the list of top 10 causes of death in U.S.
item.description: For the first time since 2020, COVID is not one of the 10 leading causes of death in the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
For the first time since 2020, COVID is not one of the 10 leading causes of death in the U.S.

(Image credit: BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Right wing activist Charlie Kirk fatally shot at speaking event in Utah
item.description: Utah officials say the suspected shooter was dressed in "all dark clothing" and fired from a long distance, potentially on a roof.
item.content:encoded:
Utah officials say the suspected shooter was dressed in "all dark clothing" and fired from a long distance, potentially on a roof.

(Image credit: Tess Crowley/AP)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Israel's attacks on Hamas in Qatar stun the Gulf and dash chances for a Gaza ceasefire
item.description: Qatar slams Israeli attacks on Hamas leaders in Doha as "state terrorism" after the bombardment rocks the tiny U.S. ally and dashes hopes of a ceasefire in Gaza
item.content:encoded:
Qatar slams Israeli attacks on Hamas leaders in Doha as "state terrorism" after the bombardment rocks the tiny U.S. ally and dashes hopes of a ceasefire in Gaza

(Image credit: Karim Jaafar)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Right-wing activist and media personality Charlie Kirk has been shot and killed
item.description: Charlie Kirk, CEO and co-founder of the conservative youth organization Turning Point USA, was shot Wednesday at an outdoor rally at a Utah college.
item.content:encoded: Charlie Kirk, CEO and co-founder of the conservative youth organization Turning Point USA, was shot Wednesday at an outdoor rally at a Utah college.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Life on Mars? NASA says a rock sample shows potential signs of ancient life
item.description: Ancient organisms may have left microscopic "biosignatures" on Mars. That's according to NASA scientists, who say a rock sample offers the most concrete proof yet that the red planet once hosted life.
item.content:encoded: Ancient organisms may have left microscopic "biosignatures" on Mars. That's according to NASA scientists, who say a rock sample offers the most concrete proof yet that the red planet once hosted life.
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: An election law expert weighs in on Trump's effort to reshape our democracy
item.description: Before 2026's midterms, President Trump wants to ban mail-in ballots and electronic voting machines, and change voting rules. Legal expert Richard Hasen discusses the future of free and fair elections.
item.content:encoded: Before 2026's midterms, President Trump wants to ban mail-in ballots and electronic voting machines, and change voting rules. Legal expert Richard Hasen discusses the future of free and fair elections.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: Trump makes a rare D.C. restaurant visit to tout his federal crackdown on crime
item.description: In his first term, President Trump only dined out at the steakhouse in his former hotel. He visited a steakhouse near the White House on Tuesday, saying, "I wouldn't have done this three months ago."
item.content:encoded:
In his first term, President Trump only dined out at the steakhouse in his former hotel. He visited a steakhouse near the White House on Tuesday, saying, "I wouldn't have done this three months ago."

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Fired FBI agents allege retribution, incompetence at top security agency
item.description: The lawsuit from three senior and lauded FBI agents at the bureau says Trump administration demanded loyalty for those staying at the bureau.
item.content:encoded:
The lawsuit from three senior and lauded FBI agents at the bureau says Trump administration demanded loyalty for those staying at the bureau.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: California considers allowing doctors to prescribe abortion drugs anonymously
item.description: If passed, the law would protect doctors from legal risk by letting them omit their names from prescription labels for abortion pills. It would affect the many doctors who use California pharmacies.
item.content:encoded:
If passed, the law would protect doctors from legal risk by letting them omit their names from prescription labels for abortion pills. It would affect the many doctors who use California pharmacies.

(Image credit: Natalie Behring)
item.dc:creator: Patrick Adams
